lines.text: Force him? I'd marry her twenty million, if she had two heads and a clubbed foot!
Aren't you going in the pool?
Oh, certainly not! It's much more clever to stay dressed and make people think how wonderful I'd be undressed.
Tea? Your Granny's hind leg! I've just come from one cocktail party and I'm on my way to another!
What did Brighton do? What did he do!
Well, to put it simply, Mother, he socked me right in the puss.
Now, if you would only see that you and I would make a much better combination than you and Brighton.
We'd be terrible. I'm Kansas and your Oxford-accent gives me a pain in the neck.
Why, I'd even cut that out for you, old thing.
I say, don't splash me up. Do you mind? I'm not dressed for this.
Well, I'm an excellent swimmer, old friend; but I don't look my best in a bathing suit.
Well, you certainly do, Lena. Why aren't you in?
Oh, I never go in the water, too. But, I adore the air on my body.
It doesn't sound quite proper to me.
Why talk about husbands? Unless you had something constructive to offer, like how to keep them from getting fat or bald headed.
